alert.note: Alert for Dawson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 22 at 8:52PM CDT until further notice by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Platte River near Darr affecting Dawson County. .Flooding along the Platte River near Darr is expected to continue for several days. While the river may briefly fall below flood stage on Friday and Saturday, the river is expected to rise back above flood stage and peak early next week. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Platte River near Darr. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding of the low lying land right along the river can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Thursday was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.6 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 07/09/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
